pages.title: I'm New
pages.metaDescription: Welcome to Eltham Green Community Church - A diverse, thriving church in Eltham, Royal Greenwich, London
heroMessages: Get connected in small groups throughout the week
Want to know more? Let's meet for a coffee, perhaps at Fresh Ground Coffee House
pages.content:
YOU ARE WELCOME!

Whether you have recently found us online, or you have visited us in person. We extend to you a warm welcome. If you have not been with us on a Sunday we encourage you to come along at 11:00am (doors open at 10:30 - usually for refreshments, except over August we start with prayer). We enjoy greeting any visitors, whether you are passing through or looking for a church family, or simply interested in faith and have questions. Whatever your reason you will find a warm reception and a decent cup of coffee waiting for you.

WHAT TO EXPECT

Start with a coffee..

We always start with tea and coffee and an opportunity to greet visitors, catch up briefly with friends and enjoy being together. Community is important to us. We also follow our meetings with more time for refreshments.

Worship and a message

Our meetings start with worship. We call this 'open worship', which means there is more of a flow of singing, praise and prayers together followed by a talk from the bible with some application. We believe in the desire of God to speak to us and also to change our lives, even in this gathering.

FOR ALL AGES

Young and old are welcome

Youth and children go out to their own groups instead of the bible talk. We are a family church so we love the little ones and they are free to be involved in our worship together. We have a variety of groups running while the Sunday message is shared including Adventurers up till 7 and Explorers from 8-14 years. Our older teenagers join the main church in the meeting.

GET CONNECTED

Church for us is more than Sundays

We have various Community Groups that happen during the week. We encourage our church family to be more than Sunday attenders where they can really find support, care and encouragement.

See our Community Groups page for details.

We enjoy greeting any visitors, whether you are passing through or looking for a church family, or simply interested in faith and have questions. Whatever your reason you will find a warm reception and a decent cup of coffee waiting for you.


We look forward to seeing you again soon!

pages.subtitle: What to expect when you come to EGCC

pages.title: About the Church
pages.metaDescription: Learn about Eltham Green Community Church - Loving Eltham since 1979
pages.content:
Loving Eltham since 1979

Formed in Eltham in 1975 as Eltham Green Fellowship at 4 Eltham Green, the church grew within the next 18 months to 100 people gathering in the home. God was moving in amazing ways at the time we moved three doors up to 1 Eltham Green for the main meetings while the Sunday School remained at number 4. Soon the numbers had reached 130 people. We had to soon move on as the gathering was causing problems for the neighbours.

In 1981 after some temporary homes the church purchased the Methodist Church building on the corner of Haimo Road, a short distance from Eltham Green. In 1982 the church moved in and this has been our church building since. The building has grown through development to include more rooms, a larger main hall, two residential flats and more recently a Coffee Shop.

Our heart has always been to be a centre in the community where the church and local community can connect together, with the church blessing the local community. In 2017 we started the Fresh Ground Coffee House which has seen our building opened up for many who simply want to have a drink or lunch, or to attend a wide variety of activities for the family.

An independent, networking, church

We are part of a network of churches called MissionLifeGrace (MLG). A group of churches walking together to love God, share the love of God to the world and grow disciples. We are all independent but share the same heart for God. We are evangelical, charismatic and seek to live out the life of God in holy living as we see in the scriptures.

A church family

Originally started as a house church we still hold those benefits of family life. We love to do things together including our children. We love to care for and support one another. We certainly are not a church that is content to 'just turn up'.

A church of community groups

We believe that church is more than a Sunday meeting. Community Groups (Life Groups) are at the heart of how we do church. These smaller groups meet regularly to study the Bible, pray together, support one another, and reach out to our community.

pages.title: Community Groups
pages.heroSubtitle: Growing in relationship with God together
pages.metaDescription: Join a Community Group at Eltham Green Community Church - Growing in relationship with God together
pages.content:
Life together is always better

Church is more than a meeting. More than a song time. More than a message.

Church is a group of believers brought together with a common desire - to know God personally and to become more like him.

The best way we can grow in God is with others. When we walk with others there are people to pick us up when we are down, we can lift up when we are encouraged.

In our Community Groups our goal is to enjoy learning to follow Christ, worship and praying together and enjoying the walk together through life. Learning to live out the words of the bible is key to a purpose driven life. Even more, through the bible we know Jesus and hear him speak to us.

Living this in community encourages each other and helps us learn together and from each other.

Each Life Group will seek to Love God through worship and the word, love each other through serving and supporting, and loving our community through connecting and inviting.

We have a number of Community Groups that operate out of homes and at the building. These groups often are on different days and times.

cta.text: Get in Touch to Join a Group

pages.title: Activities
pages.heroSubtitle: Part of the local community since 1975
pages.metaDescription: Serving our community - Fresh Ground Coffee House, Jumping Beans, and more activities at EGCC
pages.content:
We love our local community

Come and enjoy a great coffee, tea or hot chocolate at Fresh Ground Coffee House. Or bring your child to Jumping Beans. If you are older you will enjoy Songs of the Sixties. Weekly food available through the Food Club, a great way to get fresh food at a very low cost.

All our activities are designed to serve and to share with our local community.

We look forward to welcoming you!

Fresh Ground Coffee House

Fresh Ground is our coffee shop which is open every week from Wednesday to Saturday from 9:30am to 2:00pm. Serving food and drink including the best coffee in Eltham.

This is a place where all can come and meet others. A real community cafe feel and activities that run for toddlers and olders.

View the website for more details: www.freshgroundeltham.co.uk

pages.title: Audio
pages.heroSubtitle: Keep up to date with our sermons each week
pages.metaDescription: Listen to sermons and audio messages from Eltham Green Community Church
pages.content:
Listen to Our Messages

We're working on making our sermons and messages available online. Check back soon for audio content from our Sunday services and special events.

In the meantime, join us in person on Sundays at 10:30 AM to hear God's word and be part of our worship community.

sections.title: Listen to Our Messages
sections.content:
We're working on making our sermons and messages available online. Check back soon for audio content from our Sunday services and special events.

In the meantime, join us in person on Sundays at 10:30 AM to hear God's word and be part of our worship community.

pages.title: Online Catch up
pages.metaDescription: Watch our services online - Videos and content from Eltham Green Community Church
pages.content:
Watch Online

View videos from our church services and events. Watch our services online and stay connected with our church family.

Subscribe to our YouTube channel to get notified when new content is available.

sections.title: Watch Online
sections.content:
View videos from our church services and events. Watch our services online and stay connected with our church family.

Subscribe to our YouTube channel to get notified when new content is available.

team.name: John Watson
team.quote: John has been in the church from the beginning and made a commitment to Christ at the age of 18. Lived in Eltham attending local schools then working in the city. Having been self-employed since '94, John now also works part-time in Fleet Street and has lead the church for the last 20 years. He is married to Janna and has three children and loves coffee and café culture.

team.name: Daniel Bull
team.quote: Daniel has been at EGCC since becoming a Christian at the age of 13. Through the years he has worked with the children and youth, led prayer teams and been involved in the ministry of the Word. He is married to Louisa and they have three sons. Daniel enjoys doing Parkrun and playing games if he gets the chance.

team.name: Alan Robinson
team.quote: Alan is a long term member of EGCC and has held a number of roles. Alan launched Greenwich Foodbank as it is known today, joining many separate groups together. Alan is married to Esme and has 3 children and a number of grandchildren. He has also been a Trustee, Fresh Ground Coffee House director for many years and continues to play a large supporting role in church life.

team.name: Adam Bull
team.quote: Adam has been a follower of Jesus for 28 years and has served in full-time ministry for the past 18 years. Much of that time has been spent in South Africa, where he's been involved in various ministries and church plants, driven by a deep passion to see people experience new life and purpose in Jesus. He is married to Bulelwa, and together they've been blessed with two energetic boys, aged 4 and 2.

settings.teamDescription: EGCC is led by an Eldership Team. The team is led by our Senior Pastor John Watson who will seek God for the vision of the church.  We take responsibility together for the life and care of the church.  The Elders, with their wives, are supported by many others who take a leadership role whether that be in leading Worship, Ministry, Community Groups, Youth and Children's work and other church and community activities.

activities.title: Fresh Ground Coffee House
activities.description: Fresh Ground is our coffee shop which is open every week from Wednesday to Saturday from 9:30am to 2:00pm. Serving food and drink including the best coffee in Eltham.

activities.title: Jumping Beans
activities.description: Bring your child to Jumping Beans - a fun and safe space for children to play, learn, and make friends. A welcoming environment for families in our community.

activities.title: Songs of the Sixties
activities.description: If you are older, you will enjoy Songs of the Sixties - a nostalgic gathering where we celebrate the music and memories of a golden era together.

activities.title: Food Club
activities.description: Weekly food available through the Food Club - a great way to get fresh food at a very low cost. Supporting our community with affordable, quality groceries.
